Posts.Title: Breast biopsy scheduled, scared.
Being Mom..

Posts.Content:
hehe sounds like you have a purty full life too! I grew up with split parents but even after they both married again, we all went camping and had fun together step parents and all, dad played guitar and taught my brothers and their friends so it was also LOUD, I remember mom making pans of lasagna and always seem to remain calm through it all I soo admired her!... I was blessed I guess that there wasnt much friction, or at least I never seen it ~except for my brother's fighting over who was better than who.. heh my younger life was filled with so many birthday parties, bbq's, graduations, anniversarys etc.. that it kept me pretty much occupied from gettin into trouble, well to some extent ;)~ 
Like you, I had tons of different cultures and personalities walkin in and out of my life, so I learned real young not to judge anyone for their beliefs... Being the youngest I got to see things from all angles too which helped me I think to look through other peoples eyes and understand where they were comin from.. 
Oh and animals! ~>very important part of my life, we had horses,pigs,geese, chickens..... 3 legged dogs heh jk, not really but I'm sure there was at least one stray we picked up that I think was blind, he kept walking into things...
My adult life seems more dull compared to how I grew up, but it don't stop me from being a kid infront of my own kids... I'm sure they will have some crazy stories to later =} hmm like ma lockin herself outta the house in the middle of the night.. still shakin my head in disbelief!!
Hugs right back at ya MK!
Posts.Title: Being Mom..

Posts.Content:
OH THANK YOU! The last surgeries I've had were I guess ~all~ wow come to think of it yes ALL were emergency related... I didn't know they go through that much when it's a scheduled one..
It's making so much sense right now, I can't tell you enough how grateful I am that you shared with me... unfortunately even though that doctor did his best at explaining things, it was done in under 30 mins before his next patient..
Wouldn't it be nice to have a doctor actually spend the time he needs or the patient needs to be completely thorough? Not the usual 15 min visit or in extreme cases 30 mins visits?? The nurse did write down her number on a card and told me to call if I had any questions, but that day I went in there was soooooo many people in worse situations than me that had been waiting a long time past their appts.. It makes me sad, to think first off there is so many people that need help, second that they have a such a small amount of time to give to those people :(
Posts.Title: This time tommorrow

Posts.Content: Ya know, I try!  I have to though, even though I have my ma around that's about it.. Sooo I'm tryin to keep sane infront of my kids, they seen me cry enough when I had my surgeries from dealin with crohn's and this is just another thing I gotta try to overcome.. These last couple of days tho~ I'm either numb or just putting the 31st off my mind completely whichever it is, it's helpin! well kinda......
Posts.Title: This time tommorrow

Posts.Content: Good to hear your first chemo went well.. I hope the rest do its job so you dont have to go through this again.. Praying for a full recovery!
Posts.Title: chemo went great

Posts.Content:
Ty Gma for boardhoppin :) That means alot to me, I don't know her and I thought it would be kewl if someone she knew would see what we typed and printed it out to take with her to the hospital, after I thought about it.. I guess maybe I shoulda asked first =\ 
When I was going through one of my surgeries in 03 I had a friend actually do that for me.. It was so kewl, to read the hello's and prayers from all the crohnie peeps I knew.. There's not much to do but watch tv, do crossword puzzles and sleep! hehe 
I liked how you have a separate thread for just prayers and blessings for the week.. your soo compassionate Gma!
Posts.Title: Urgent

Posts.Content:
*praying continually* 
Its nice to know she has you by her side... I'm praying for you also, hope you are able to get some rest for the days ahead..
Posts.Title: Continued Prayers for Becky...

Posts.Content: Adding prayers for Betty too.. that she is given her body a rest from all her pain to enjoy the life she has without being hurt..
Posts.Title: Talked to Shelley and Connie!

Posts.Content: K, For the most part since the surgery I've had no problems except some itching and dryness around the nipple.. but yesterday I woke up and my nitey had a yellow stain about the size of a 50cent piece and of course I thought nothing of it, maybe I spilled something but then today I felt a little pressure and it was more tender than usual and I am wearing a teeshirt and there are more little yellow stains, I am SOOO TRYING NOT TO FREAK OUT! I know I didn't spill anything and come to think of it, how could I last night in my sleep!!?? It's coming from the incision but it doesnt smell like an infection, but it does have a strange odor.. UGH PLEASE SOMEONE BE ON TONIGHT?? It's almost 9 my time and my doctor I'm sure is home and in bed.. Hopefully one of you is up!
Posts.Title: Trying to remain calm!

Posts.Content: hi thanks, that makes sense but why would it be yellow, almost neon color? no blood, no fever~ well chills but that could be from anything.. and its kinda pinkish around the spot but its not feverish near the incision... I just know they are wanna go pick on me again and I am being a baby about it....
Posts.Title: Trying to remain calm!

Posts.Content:
Did you window shop or buy something really fancy? ;) Glad she was able to go out and get some fresh air and have some fun...
My prayers are with you both still, such a wonderful friend you are!
Posts.Title: Continued Prayers for Becky...
Pain Free Ideas!

Posts.Content: Rest in dear sweet peace Connie,  Thank you for every glimpse of hope, even the tears, and especially for everything you shared while you were here, you will be missed!!  No more pain, no more fear, all sunshine and flowers from now on.. I know your still around and you can hear all of us praying for your family and friends that you left behind when you went home... Know that they are in my heart and prayers...with much love, Connie
Posts.Title: Many of us have just received emails from Connie's DH Bob.

Posts.Content: Continue'in the prayers for Becky.. I do hope she can find relief in all thats going on, lessen the pain alittle at least, plz God? And watch out for Angela too that she gets some rest while being there for her.. Ty God!
Posts.Title: No news is good news on Becky

Posts.Content: Adding my prayers for Connie too!
Posts.Title: Connie is in the hospital!

Posts.Content: That is soooo kewl! Its wonderful to hear such wonderful news and brings hope!
Posts.Title: Got the results from my tests today.......

Posts.Content:
Hi thank you all for your input on how it's done, i was worried prolly for the worst that one of the reasons they were doing it was because it was more serious than they were letting up on.. 
Thank you Rita, Softy, & Candy~ helped me alot!! TY TY TY!
Di, i checked your profile and it doesnt give any email :(
Posts.Title: Scared

Posts.Content:
I fairly new to bc forum, but I am praying for her.. I hope all turns out ok, glad she has someone like you to be by her side..
I'll keep both of you in my prayers
Posts.Title: Prayers for Becky for good MRI results tomorrow

Posts.Content:
*shivers* yes montana, kinda glad that sweater was out there! 
I do, have soooo much fun with them!!.. I really like their ages now..Chris is 13, Nikki 10, Natty 8... The girls are 15 mos apart, and almost drive me nuts with always competing for this and that.. my son always whispers to me, "why? why did you have to have GIRLS! I wanted brothers! " He loves them tho, no matter how much he says he don't.. they don't believe him when he says that and they climb all over him teasin him pickin on him.. all I hear is "MAAAAAAAAWM! come'on get them off me! ground them or somethin!" hehe but all I can do is laugh, I grew up with 4 brudders and I know how he feels.. 
They, well "us" can be so entertaining that the neighborhood kids come floodin in.. and then it gets a little chaotic, but the days when I don't feel good~ They are soo sweet to me, offerin me water etc and scurry around the house pickin up after themselves.. *giggles* I hear them sometimes, argue'n with each other saying "HUSH... mom, doesnt feel good!" ugh.. those are the days I could just crawl under a rock and hide.. :( I am still gettin used to being not as energetic as I was 2yrs ago, stupid crohn's has to interfere! But that's different subject.. 
Anyways, I'm grateful for alot.. especially being able to open up here and share the good and the bad ;)

Hope your first treatment turns out ok..

Posts.Content: I am going in for my biopsy at 2:30, I can't sleep, I don't really feel anything right now about what it is I have to do.. other than being numb..

Posts.Title: Prayers for my Mother

Posts.Content:
I havent had chemo, but I woke up this morning with my teeth sooooo sensitive that anything hot or cold just sent a pain shooting for seconds on end.. I thought it was strange, because it's not just 1 tooth it seems like all of them are tender kinda like an abscess feels when you need a root canal done
It's let up a little tonight, I was thinkin that it was because I was soo nervous before the surgery that maybe I clamped down on them soo hard when I was put under.. Do you clench your teeth when you sleep?
Posts.Title: Anyone have sore teeth after chemo?

Posts.Content: I don't know how you women can hold up and bring so much faith and inspiration to all those who are inflicted with this *$^%* !!!

Hi, there is a lady on the crohns board with a very urgent prayer needed.. If you could hop over there and send her some warm thoughts and/or prayers I'm sure her and her family would be very grateful.. I believe in the miracle of God, and I'm praying he will hear all our prayers.. Her time is precious as with all of us, but it doesnt sound like she has had the best help and now they are preparing for the worst
Posts.Title: Urgent

Posts.Content: Warm thoughts for Denise, I hope all is well with her..
Posts.Title: Has there been an update on Denise?
Scared
Scared

Posts.Content:
I see it! k gonna email you after I post :)
Thanks again Gma for helpin out ...
I did something really silly today, my mom and I went to the beauty supply store and when we were there, I decided why not dye my hair? Asked the lady what would be the best highlighter and she pointed me in the right direction... funny thing is I've had fun with my hair doing all kinds of crazy things but this hit the top of the list today, we came back to my house and started the process after i bent over to rinse my hair, my mom BURSTS out laughing...!! I couldnt see because i was still rinsing my hair, she couldnt stop and I knew then it was funky.. so i stood up and looked in the mirror and 2 inches of my roots were pure white and the rest was a very neon orange.. I ABOUT FAINTED!! I went back and got something to fix it, but we musta laughed for about 2 hours ... off and on, if I seen a sign on the street ~ even remotely close to orange I'd point and we'd giggle again.. Oh what a day, kinda was nice to get my mind off of things.... tehehehee

Posts.Title: Urgent

Posts.Content: Well Ladies! I am home and lumpless!  Very exhausting week of worrying just got dumped off at the nearest dumpster.. Now I just have to wait for the results, still praying it's B9.. So if you could toss a few prayers my way? I hopefully find out by wednesday, but doc's says it's lookin about 99.9 % B9,  I am overly thrilled that the lump is gone, could almost feel normal.. if thats possible..
Posts.Title: Surgery Today
Having surgery, again!

Posts.Content: I ended up callin the doctor on call tonight, he told me to go in tommorrow morning to my surgern..from what it sounds like is fluid is building up in the hole from the lump they removed (it was pretty big actually bigger than I thought) and they'll prolly take a needle to it to withdraw it out.. he's assuming because of my age that it still could be from the milk ducts or something like that I dont know, but he said nothing to do until tommorrow..
Posts.Title: Trying to remain calm!

Posts.Content:
hi Grammy, your prayers are 
 and they worked.. I don't want to jump the gun, but doctor said it looks about 99.9% that it's b9.. he got all of it out and I'll find out by wednesday where to go from here..

AgeInfo.Phrase: doctor said it looks about 99 9% that it's b9   he

Posts.Title: Hello Nature's spirit

Posts.Content: I was told to cut back on the amount of caffiene i was drinkin up to 3 cans of pepsi a day and chocolate?? i cant count.. but i did cut down on both and it seemed to help a little but thats when they thought it was a cyst, mine is solid.. and always tender especially around my period, everytime i go in the doc asks me 'is there a chance you could be pregnant?' im like NO heh now they are checking mine out on thursday, prayers to you... and peace to ease the mind :)
Posts.Title: Cysts / Painful breasts

Posts.Content: I wonder too about that MK, this past week since the catscan.. I can feel the lump more than before.. and OMG the intense itching around my nipple, it's driving me crazy and it wasnt this bad 2 wks ago! At nite I am more aware it's there and toss/turn till I get comfy as if I'm tryin to protect myself... It's always hurt though, thats the reason I went in 2 years ago, they kept on testing me for pregnancy because of how swollen and how much they ached (both) all the way up into my armpits ouchhhhhhhh.. so that hasnt changed =\
Posts.Title: This time tommorrow
This time tommorrow

Posts.Content:
Didn't mean to sound soo pessymistic, it's just a few thoughts here and there during the day, wondering if that's normal.. 
I guess I am gettin more nervous bout the surgery, and not knowing a thing about breast cancer~well I guess I've heard the worst cases it seems like everyone loves to share the horror stories and rarely ever tell of the positive side so thank you MK & Cindy.. I'm tryin my best =}
Even though it hurts.. I keep wondering maybe I should just did the biopsy first when I had the chance because it would be over with by now, I'd know.. 
At the sametime I'm wondering what it'll be like not feelin that lump no more.. kinda almost excited it's been hidin in the back of my head for the past 2 yrs wondering what it is..
